snippet: The study was among many being presented at the annual meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology.
abstract: Study presented at annual meeting of American Society of Clinical Oncology reports that women with ovarian cancer may be able to stave off relapses for extra half-year or so by taking GlaxoSmithKline drug Votrient, already approved to treat kidney cancer.
lead_paragraph: The study was among many being presented at the annual meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology.

headline.main: Drug Used to Treat Kidney Cancer May Hold Off Relapses of Ovarian Cancer
headline.print_headline: Drug Used to Treat Kidney Cancer May Hold Off Relapses of Ovarian Cancer
